titleStmt.title: Letter, Joseph Oliver Freeman in Lafayette, Georgia, to Indiana Freeman, 1863 September 16

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, Joseph Oliver Freeman in Lafayette, Georgia, to Indiana Freeman, 1863 September 16
bibl.note: Joseph Oliver Freeman Letters, 1861 December 22 - 1864 June 12, undated

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for The University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Corrections have been applied to the text only where there is a high degree of certainty of an error and if the correct spelling is known.
Corrections are represented by editorial tags.
Quotation marks and apostrophes have been replaced by entity references.
All unambiguous end-of-line hyphens have been removed.
Names of persons, places, and organizations are indicated in the transcription when identifiable with a high degree of certainty.

revisionDesc.change: Updated earlier transcription from the old TEI.2 system to anticipate and resolve difficulties and issues with re-formatting letters from this collection into TEI-P5 lite.

Added "idno" element, editorial declaration statement, subjects/keywords and abstracts from EAD finding aid. Removed box and folder notes, reference declaration element. Changed the formatting for blank pages. Added resp attributes to editorial changes, and added name tags.

opener.dateline: Camp near Lafayette, gorgeyGeorgia Sepetember the 16 D 1863

div.p: I receve yor letter the 15 of this month and I was glad to hear from you and littel Joe and glad to hear younes was well yor letter found me well and I hope wehn thes few lines comes to hand that thay may find you and littel Joe I has no newes to rite at this time oly we expect a fite before long we left Chattanooga abote tow weekes a go the yankees sheld the town for tow weekes befor we left thar thay kild a woman and Child by Shelen the town

ed skeles got hear saft I was glad to see him he brot me tow pear of sox wich you sent to me I was glad to git them for I had none ed told me ol the nuse yor brothr John has bin up har but he has gone back Henry is well Franke was well the last

time I hear from him I was sarray to hear of Mr Davis Dethe I fel very sarray for seter magrat tel Luis to come back he wont be hurt Inda thar has bin the grates revivel in our brigad that ever I seen Inda I perfest religen I am redy to meet littel alje in heven Inda sead the yankee was a goin to make you ol take the oth ef thay forse you to take hit wi you had betr take I rekin for thay take evver thing you got Inda ef you wont eney money git sum from Mrs Skeles git abote tharty Dolars and I will pay ede hear for hit rite to me wth you git hit ar not
I am lookin for ordes to leve hear evr minet so you must excuse my short letter we have plenty to eat and heap of hard march to Dow Inda kiss littel Joe for me

god bless hear littel sole I wist I cud git to see hear giv my best repeckes to John stokes and famley and ol the connextion and frendes giv my lov to Mrs skeles and giney Inda giv my best love to Lara Shunt so noth mor at presen but remane yor affection Husban Joseph O Freeman
tel John stokes to take gud car of you and littel Joe
